item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 29, 2024 at 11:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Jimmy Carter has died (539 points | 222 comments)
2. Is Iceland getting ready to join the EU? (130 points | 210 comments)
3. The deadliest tsunami set off work to be ready for the next big wave (24 points | 7 comments)
4. Are PC hardware companies driving technology into restricted closed ecosystems? (144 points | 92 comments)
5. Apple Photos phones home on iOS 18 and macOS 15 (1130 points | 846 comments)
6. The last Inca bridge master (23 points | discuss)
7. WebGL Fluid Simulation (340 points | 45 comments)
8. Stripe V2 (12 points | 1 comment)
9. I Run LLMs Locally (175 points | 103 comments)
10. Build a working game of Tetris in Conway's Game of Life (2014) (154 points | 15 comments)
11. Trying to use Bluesky without getting burned again (93 points | 148 comments)
12. BSD kqueue is a mountain of technical debt (2021) (109 points | 74 comments)
13. BioTerrorism Will Save Your Life with the 4 Thieves Vinegar Collective [video] (132 points | 119 comments)
14. Om Malik – The Story of Stent (10 points | discuss)
15. Toronto man creates tiny mobile homes to help unhoused people escape the cold (160 points | 118 comments)
16. Intel's $475M error: the silicon behind the Pentium division bug (330 points | 99 comments)
17. Melbourne Train Control System is running on a hardware emulated PDP11 (75 points | 15 comments)
18. 'No Problem' Word Processor Poses a Problem for Former President Carter (1981) (4 points | discuss)
19. Breaking NATO Radio Encryption [video] (50 points | 12 comments)
20. The Zombocom Problem (7 points | discuss)
21. TWISTED: The dramatic history of twisted-pair Ethernet (6 points | 1 comment)
22. Racket-embed-images-in-source-text (38 points | 8 comments)
23. Where can you go in Europe by train in 8h? (599 points | 385 comments)
24. I automated my job application process (560 points | 774 comments)
25. 38C3: Illegal Instructions (411 points | 63 comments)
26. We've not been trained for this: life after the Newag DRM disclosure [video] (339 points | 55 comments)
27. Show HN: Kando – A cross-platform pie menu for your desktop (76 points | 31 comments)
28. Can LLMs accurately recall the Bible? (112 points | 63 comments)
29. Using AZs can eat up your budget – From Prometheus to VictoriaMetrics (65 points | 43 comments)
30. Board game from Mexican prisons brings together people from all walks of life (27 points | 4 comments)
item.guid: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, December 29, 2024 at 11:15 PM UTC
